page.title: 08FILTER STATION GREENOCK
page.content: The {Maukinhill Filter Station}was built in 1940 and was in use by 1941, having an output of 1,420,000 gallons per day. The filter station derives its untreated water from the{Gryffe No1 {and No2 reservoirs},which are approximately 10 miles South-East of the filter station. The supply is conveyed from the Gryffe reservoirs via a tunnel. The water works consists of 12 8ft diameter mechanically agitated filters arranged in two batteries of six and 2 lime tanks. The water works doesn't just pump water, it pumps out chlorine gas to the public baths. Before water is pumped to the houses it has to be filtered and cleaned. {What would we do without "clean" {water?}
